results.title: Street kids
results.creator_credit: York St Film Productions, Film Victoria, Kent Chadwick, Leigh Tilson and Rob Scott
results.brief_description: A documentary about homeless youths, some as young as 10, surviving by any means on the streets of Melbourne. Various young people are interviewed about their situation and their search for jobs and accommodation. Highlights the frustrations they face and the resultant temptation to fall into crime and prostitution in order to survive. Police and social workers who deal with these young people from day to day comment on the situation and how they attempt to alleviate the despair of those they encounter. Use of voice-overs (street kids talking about their lives) is very effective as well as disturbing. A courageous and compelling documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: York St Film Productions, Film Victoria, Kent Chadwick, Leigh Tilson and Rob Scott

results.title: Time for living
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Education and Ken McLean
results.brief_description: Shows how school camps can provide different kinds of learning experiences which can develop skills and ways of relating that are not possible in the classroom.

results.title: Living Pictures Cinematograph: Clown
results.brief_description: A flipbook / flick book of twenty-six pages designed in such a way that when flicked it creates a sense of movement, in this example, a clown tips his hat. Small outer corners lost from front cover.
